{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mesonephros is a temporary kidney that develops in vertebrates and contributes to the formation of certain structures in the reproductive system. According to Document [10], in males, the mesonephros gives rise to the efferent ductules of the testis, the epididymis, vas deferens, and seminal vesicle. The paroophoron, as mentioned in the same document, is a vestigial structure in females that is also derived from the mesonephros. However, the glomerulus is a part of the mature kidney or nephrons, and according to Document [0], the mesonephric nephrons do not form any part of the mature kidney or nephrons, which includes the glomerulus.", "answer_choice": "D. Glomerulus"}
